result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Return date on June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John M. Rodenkirch in court. Defendant stated he called the SPD office and is not eligible. Not sure at this time if he wants to have a court appointed attorney or if he will hire one on his own. Court set new return date. Defendant was given indigency forms by clerk. 10:33 AM
Return date scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Standard felony conditions. Maintain absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:40 am. Return date scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.

1:20 PM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant John M. Rodenkirch appeared by video in custody from the Columbia County Jail with Attorney Claire Edwards. Waived reading. Right to atty. $500.00 cash bond. Standard felony conditions. Maintain absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages. Not operate motor vehicle without a valid license. Waived time limits. Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:40 am. Return date scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 10:45 am. 1:25 PM
